newsitem.title: JAPAN: Nichiei Co up as loss fears fade.
newsitem.headline: Nichiei Co up as loss fears fade.

text.p: Shares in Nichiei Co Ltd rose in early Thursday morning trade as investors discounted interim special losses the lumber dealing company said it would post due to the filing for bankruptcy of its finance unit, brokers said.
As of 0025 GMT, the shares were up 18 yen at 328 yen with a turnover of 5.905 million shares. It was the most heavily traded issue on the Tokyo Stock Exchange first section.

Nichiei Co said on Tuesday it would post a 12.3 billion yen extraordinary loss in its earnings for the six months to September 30, 1996, due to the filing for protection from creditors by its unit Nichiei Finance Co Ltd.
Nichiei Finance, which is due to delist from the exchange on January 23, 1997, was ask-only at 110 yen.
The shares, which resumed trade on Wednesday after being suspended the day before, were ask-only throughout Wednesday's session at 120 yen.
